profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Gertrude Franzel-Koehler lived in Hellerau, near Dresden, Germany. She illustrated these texts for Dr. Ernst Jockers of the University of Pennsylvania. She once saw a poem by Dr. Jockers in a German newspaper and liked it so much that she illustrated it and sent it to him. She sent him other sheets over a period of about seven years (1948-1955). She was a personal friend of Gerhart Hauptmann and wrote all of his poems and many of his plays in this manner. She also wrote original poetry. Her husband was in charge of the restoration of the Zwinger in Dresden, which had been destroyed during World War II.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of hand lettered and decorated copies of German literary works, done by Gertrude Frenzel-Koehler of Hellerau for Professor Ernst Jockers in the approximate period 1948-1955. The manuscripts include excerpts from Goethe's Faust, Die Geschwister, Der Granit, and Iphigenie auf Tauris; Hesse's Gesprach Knulp mit Gott; Hauptmann's Die blaue Blume, and Weichert's Marchen.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
